page.title: 11BROMPTON &SAWDON C.P. SCHOOL
page.content: {BROMPTON & SAWDON C.P. SCHOOL }serves the villages of Brompton and Sawdon. The Sawdon children are taxied to school. The school was built in {1878}of local limestone with a welsh slate roof. It has a bell in a tower which we still ring to call us in at break. There are two main classrooms in the school, the biggest one has a movable partition and is also used for as a dining room. The kitchen was added on after the war. We now use the adjoining school house as an office, library, music room and store room. We have an automatic oil fired burner which helps keep out the cold wind. Our playground is very tiny but we can play cricket in it all the year round. The school garden is very tiny but we can play there in good weather because it is mainly grass.
